channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15386] Expose Spark task counts and stage Ids information in SparkTask from SparkJobMonitor
item.description: Expose Spark task counts and stage Ids information in SparkTask from SparkJobMonitor. So these information can be used by hive hook to monitor spark jobs.
item.summary: Expose Spark task counts and stage Ids information in SparkTask from SparkJobMonitor

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12842285 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
zxu, could you elaborate on how these task infos will be used? I don't think SparkTask is intended for public use. Also pinging xuefuz for opinions.
Yeah, it seems a little invasive with the proposed changes. Let's see if we can somehow abstract this and expose to hooks w/o exposing too much internals. Will chat with Zhihai in person.

Thanks for the review xuefuz and lirui! The first patch changed too many files. I upload a new patch which only change one file sparkTask.java. The patch read the spark job information(tasks and stageIds) right after the job finished. Since the sparkTask can be got from hook by Utilities.getSparkTasks. we will get tasks and stageIds information in hooks with this patch.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12842683/HIVE-15386.001.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12842683 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Hi zxu, the v1 patch looks better. One question is what's the difference between startTime and submitTime? And why is startTime set like this (with a PerfLogger and after the task finishes)?

startTime = perfLogger.getEndTime(PerfLogger.SPARK_SUBMIT_TO_RUNNING);

And btw, is this intended to expose some hook for user to monitor the job? I think even Utilities is not for public use.

thanks for the review lirui! Submit time is when the spark job is submitted to spark. Start time is when the job is running.
there may be some delay between submit time and start time. for example, wait to get resource to run the job.
PerfLogEnd for SPARK_SUBMIT_TO_RUNNING is called when the spark job enters running state

              perfLogger.PerfLogEnd(CLASS_NAME, PerfLogger.SPARK_SUBMIT_TO_RUNNING);

the end time for SPARK_SUBMIT_TO_RUNNING is the same as the start time.
Looks like the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ATSHook uses Utilities to get MR tasks and Tez task currently.

            int numMrJobs = Utilities.getMRTasks(plan.getRootTasks()).size();
            int numTezJobs = Utilities.getTezTasks(plan.getRootTasks()).size();

Thanks zxu for the explanations. Then I think submitTime can also be retrieved from PerfLogger, e.g. by calling getStartTime?
I know Utilities is used internally. I was just thinking it's not a public interface.

yes, thanks for the review lirui! using PerfLogger to get submitTime is better, I also use PerfLogger to get finishTime in the new patch HIVE-15386.002.patch. So all the timing information is based on PerfLogger for consistency. Please review it!
